department.dept_long_name: Committee on Degrees in History and Literature

course.title: The African American Great Migration
course.description: The "Great Migration" of millions of African Americans out of the U.S. South in the twentieth century radically transformed both migrants themselves and the broader American culture. Examining letters, novels, poetry, oral histories, music, visual culture, and scholarship, we will ask: How did migrants negotiate the promises and perils of the urban North? How did migrants shape modern culture? How did they reformulate African American identity amidst this process of urbanization?
